instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK: What is SMC_BC_ACOK? This is identical to CHGR_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .
definitions.PM_BATLOW_L: What is PM_BATLOW_L? PM_BATLOW_L is a signal that tells the system the battery is too low for it to turn on & keeps it from turning on, when it is low. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.SMBUS_CHGR_SDA: What is SMBUS_CHGR_SDA? SMBUS_CHGR_SDA is the data line of an I2C data line between the battery charging chip that creates PPBUS_G3H, the system management controller(SMC), the battery, and the battery indicator LED..
definitions.SMBUS_CHGR_SCL: What is SMBUS_CHGR_SCL? SMBUS_CHGR_SCL is the clock line of an I2C data line between the battery charging chip that creates PPBUS_G3H, the system management controller(SMC), the battery, and the battery indicator LED..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with orange juice LD ---> semi repaired? Empty battery shows on screen.
threads.message:
Hi guys,

This one looked like it took a dive in an orange juice bucket. I UC it and then there was no green light. I looked around and <SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL> was missing while <SIGNAL>PP3V42_3GH</SIGNAL> was ok. The problem was <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> which I replaced and voila there is green light and the CPU gets hot.

I now half assemble the laptop to check if there is image and here is what happens. When I plug the magsafe in there are all voltages present on the motherboard at all coils and the screen shows an empty battery with a bolt (like in iPhones) for few secs - no fan spine - and it then turns off (along with all voltages except S5 voltages and <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> at 12.5 to 12.6V). That happens every time I reconnect the magsafe.

Has this macbook turned into an iPhone? Should I hook a sim card? Other ideas?

br,
george

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with orange juice LD ---> semi repaired? Empty battery shows on screen.
threads.message: What is PPBUS voltage with battery connected?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with orange juice LD ---> semi repaired? Empty battery shows on screen.
threads.message:
12.2V to 12.4V (doesn't look thrilling)

EDIT: 12.4V most of the time... dives to 12.3V rarely to 12.2V.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with orange juice LD ---> semi repaired? Empty battery shows on screen.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with orange juice LD ---> semi repaired? Empty battery shows on screen.
threads.message: but it shows the battery symbol without the battery connected, too... and then all voltages turn off.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with orange juice LD ---> semi repaired? Empty battery shows on screen.
threads.message:
Does it stay on without battery?
If OSX shows battery symbol seems that SMC "chats" with it at least.
Peel the plastic and look at battery electronic circuits.
If you see corrosion signs there, change it.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with orange juice LD ---> semi repaired? Empty battery shows on screen.
threads.message: it should start without battery but even then it shows the empty battery symbol, when the magsafe is attached, and nothing else. If you press On/Off button <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> goes LOW but nothing else happens. Also the fan does not spin..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with orange juice LD ---> semi repaired? Empty battery shows on screen.
threads.message: this symbol appears for a few secs - with or without battery - and the laptop turns off. No fan activity at all.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with orange juice LD ---> semi repaired? Empty battery shows on screen.
threads.message: The fan never spins on these when cold. I believe some of these need a good battery to start. If green/orange light is OK and PPBUS is at 12.6V I still say your battery is dead.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with orange juice LD ---> semi repaired? Empty battery shows on screen.
threads.message: so you suggest I need a good battery? shouldn't this model boot without the battery like the rest? Or maybe should I check battery communication to the SMC? Maybe there is an issue there? I will try tonight..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with orange juice LD ---> semi repaired? Empty battery shows on screen.
threads.message:
Be sure to use real 85W charger.
Check if <SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL> is high.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with orange juice LD ---> semi repaired? Empty battery shows on screen.
threads.message:
So I did some measurements and I get:

1) 3.40V at <RESISTOR>R5381</RESISTOR> (<SIGNAL>SMBUS_CHGR_SCL</SIGNAL>)
2) 0V ar <RESISTOR>R5380</RESISTOR> (<SIGNAL>SMBUS_CHGR_SDA</SIGNAL>)
3) <SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL> is low when the charger in attached (with battery connected) and remains low for the following seconds
4) <SIGNAL>CHGT_BGATE</SIGNAL> is HIGH at <TRANSISTOR>Q7155</TRANSISTOR> and does not charge the battery - the output at the Drain is 2.3V

I also did a bit of SMC heating with flux.

you have the ball.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with orange juice LD ---> semi repaired? Empty battery shows on screen.
threads.message:
2) if this is the case then PPBUS without battery should be 12.3V, confirm this. If PPBUS is 12.56V the SMBUS is fine.

I still say the battery is fucked too.
